description.dataset: Datasets contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. The NIAID Data Ecosystem is a secure environment to find, access and analyze immune-mediated and infectious disease data and computational tools to speed the development of diagnostics, therapeutics, and vaccines. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from dataset repository and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform dataset searching and filtering.
Publications, datasets, or computational tools that cite the dataset
description.computationaltool: Publications, datasets, or computational tools that cite the computational tool

description.dataset: Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, the dataset. Options include open (freely available), restricted (may include restrictions such as on use), closed (requires registration to access), or embargoed (unpublished)
description.computationaltool: Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, the computational tool. Options include open (freely available), restricted (may include restrictions such as on use), closed (requires registration to access), or embargoed (unpublished)

description.dataset: Infectious agent(s) / pathogen(s) which are the focus of the dataset (like SARS-CoV-2)
description.computationaltool: Infectious agent(s) / pathogen(s) which are the focus of the computational tool (like SARS-CoV-2)

description.dataset: The health condition(s) /infectious disease(s) which are the focus of the dataset (like COVID-19, coronavirus)
description.computationaltool: The health condition(s) / infectious disease(s) which are the focus of the computational tool (e.g. COVID-19, coronavirus)

description.dataset: Date the dataset was created
description.computationaltool: Date the computational tool was created

description.dataset: Dataset identifier or accesssion number, such as a digital object identifier (DOI), sequence read archive (SRA) or GenBank accession number, etc.
description.computationaltool: Identifier for the computational tool

description.dataset: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of this dataset through some kind of financial contribution
description.computationaltool: Funding that supports (sponsors) the development of this computational tool through some kind of financial contribution

description.description: description of the funding award / grant

description.dataset: The creator/author of this dataset; equivalent to author
description.computationaltool: The creator/author of this computational tool; equivalent to author

identifier.description: Unique identifier of the person, like an ORCID ID

role.title: Creator.role
role.description: Role the person played in creating the dataset

url.title: Creator.url
url.description: Link to the homepage or other web content describing the person

parentOrganization.title: Creator.parent Organization
parentOrganization.description: Name of the parent organization. For instance, the parentOrganization of NIAID is the National Institutes of health (NIH)

description.dataset: A citation or reference to a publication, dataset, or computational tool which uses the dataset. Examples: a publication which describes the collection/analysis of the dataset, a publication which reuses the dataset in a secondary analysis, a dataset which extends the existing dataset, or a computational tool which relies on the dataset.
description.computationaltool: A citation or reference to a publication, dataset, or computational tool which uses the computational tool. Examples: a publication which describes the development of the computational tool, a publication which describes the extension or use of the computational tool, a datset which was processed or analyzed using the tool, or a computational tool which relies on the given tool.

description.dataset: Variables measured within the dataset
Dataset name

description.dataset: A technique or technology used in a  dataset corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (described using variableMeasured). For example, if variableMeasured is molecule concentration, measurementTechnique could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence".

abstract.dataset: measurement technique used to collect the dataset

description.dataset: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the dataset. These ratings can be collected based on user reviews or through Altmetric scores of web-based citations.
description.computationaltool: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the computational tool. These ratings can be collected based on user reviews or through Altmetric scores of web-based citations.

description.dataset: URL of additional sources for the dataset
description.computationaltool: URL of additional sources for the computational tool

ComputationalTools (software, workflows, computational tools, code) contained in the NIAID Data Ecosystem. The NIAID Data Ecosystem is a secure environment to find, access and analyze immune-mediated and infectious disease data and computational tools to speed the development of diagnostics, therapeutics, and vaccines. The NIAID Data Ecosystem Discovery Portal harvests metadata from dataset repository and harmonizes them to this schema to enable easy cross-platform dataset searching and filtering.

Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).
URL to download the computational tool
Operating systems supported (Windows 7, OSX 10.6, Android 1.6).
Subcategory of the application, e.g. 'Arcade Game'.
Output of the computational tool
A link to a webpage containing the comments about the computational tool.
Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications).
software input, such as a file or parameter
Software version
The main programming language(s) used to build or execute the tool
A secondary contributor to the developement or maintenance of the computational tool

parentOrganization.description: Name of the parent organization. For instance, the parentOrganization of NIAID is the National Institutes of health (NIH)

Link to the source code repository of the tool such as GitHub
A thumbnail image of the computational tool
Type of software application, e.g. 'Game, Multimedia'.
Processor architecture required to run the application (e.g. IA64).
The name of the application suite to which the application belongs (e.g. Excel belongs to Office).
Device or platform required to run the application, such as Bioconda, Docker, or Singularity
Additional content for a software application
